result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Lynn Benton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerry Lynn Benton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jerry Lynn Benton was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall contact the Iron County Sheriff's Department at (715) 561-2440 within 10 business days of sentencing to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall also pay the surcharge for same.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry Lynn Benton

records.addlTxt: 10:36 a.m.  Court calls case 22CM1, 12CT2, 12CT5, cites appearances.  Atty Dan Johns appears on behalf of def who appears via Zoom.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Plea Agreement reached.  Attorneys state agreement.  Vic rights complied with.  Restitution has been paid in older cases.  Def understands agreement.  Willing to proceed via Zoom.  Court goes through PLQ.  Def is satisfied with rep of Atty.  Def knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently to plead per Atty Johns.  Court allows waiver of rights.  DA moves to dismiss Count #2 and 12CT2 and 5.  No objection from defense.  Court grants dismissals.  Def pleads NC to Count #1.  Def agrees.  Parties stipulate to FB.  Court finds FB.  Accepts plea, finds def guilty, JOC to be entered.  Sentencing:  DA addresses Court prior to sentencing.  Atty Johns addresses Court prior to sentencing.  Def does not exercise right of allocution.  Court orders $443.50.  Def is to provide a DNA sample.  60 DTP.  Adj.  10:56 a.m.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:29 PM  Court calls cases, cites appearances.  Atty Daniel J. Johns, Jr., appears on behalf of def.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Atty Johns spoke with client and went through PLQ.  Atty Johns requests adjournment.  No objection from DA.  Vic rights complied with.  Court grants adjournment.  Case to be scheduled ASAP.  Adj.  1:31 p.m.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
9:42 a.m.  Court calls case.  Atty Johns appears for def.  Case was set for PLEAS today but to be rescheduled.  Adj.  9:42 a.m.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Parties schedule cases for 5/10 at 10:00 a.m.   Nothing for court record.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:32 AM Attorney Daniel W Johns in court for Defendant Jerry Lynn Benton. Prosecuting Atty Matthew J Tingstad appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jerry Lynn Benton appeared by phone means.  22CM1, 12CT5, 12CF2.  Court calls all cases, cites appearances.  22CM1 has IA today.  In 22CM1, Atty Johns has reviewed with client, waives reading, understands charges/penalties.  Pleads NG.  Court asks for STC on other cases.  All cases to track together for possible resolution.  3/22 at 1:30 p.m. for PTC.  Advised to keep in touch with atty.  Def indicates bond docs mailed back.  Adj.  9:35 a.m.  klr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on March 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bond doc mailed to def.  klr

10:25 a.m.  Court calls case.  Def appears via phone.  Atty Johns is present (represents on other cases) in court, but not appointed.  Def indicates hasn't received anything yet.  Def indicates she wants atty.  Court advises to contact PD Office.  3/14 for case to be rescheduled.  Atty Johns indicates he has emailed PD's Office and said he is available to represent.  Bond was previously set, but clerk failed to send.  Bond to now be mailed to def for signature.  Adj.  10:27 a.m. klr
Initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No use or possession of alcohol and no use or possession of controlled substances without prescription.

Court calls cases, cites appearances.  STC in older cases and Initial in 22CM1.  Atty Johns present, def appears via phone.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Atty Johns on older cases through PD, not on new case yet.  Def has called PD but has not heard back yet.  All cases to be set together for 2/28 at 9:00 a.m.  Court addresses bond on 22CM1.  DA requests $500 sig bond wth conditions of no use or possession of controlled substances without prescription, or alcohol. Def to sign and return bond.  Shall also be booked at SD if not printed already.   Adj.  9:26 a.m.  klr
